result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory John Henzig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Agent to request probation review hearing with the Court ifit is needed

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs and fees.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with victim C.Z. or A.Z.  unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers intervention program.
Mental health evaluation. Comply with recommended treatment.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory John Henzig

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory John Henzig in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Gregory John Henzig in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2. On the state's motion, Court STRIKES Domestic Abuse Repeater and Habitual Criminality Repeater enhancers.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 1 DISMISSED and READ-IN for sentencing purposes.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Gregory John Henzig not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Gregory John Henzig not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 29 FOR BRANCH 35.
Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Gregory John Henzig not in court, in custody.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Gregory John Henzig in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Gregory John Henzig in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense requests to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 29 for Br 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CLZ.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gregory John Henzig in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Gregory John Henzig in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
